result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J. Guibord was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyler J. Guibord in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Defendant Tyler J. Guibord in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14 CF 165, 15 CM 139 and 14 TR 482.  State plea resolution 14 CF 165 plead to count 1 - and count 2 dismissed / nc to ct 2 in 15 CM 139 / all other counts and cases to be dismissed and used as read-ins - jt. recommendation OWI 3 yrs probation / 9 mo co. jail - $23.45 rest. - $2072.00 - 27 mo revocation of DL  - 167 days credit as to all 3 cases and owi 216 days credit time served - DC is time served and court costs.   State makes further stmt.  
Court questions defendant as to plea questionnaire.  Defendant entered plea of guilty to count 1 in 14 CF 165 and NC to count 2 in 15 CM 139.  Court finds defendant guilty of 14 CF 165 count 1 and 15 CM 139 count 2 - all other counts and cases are to be dismissed and read-in.  State argues sentencing.  Atty Larimore argues sentencing and tendered a letter to the court that the defendant has written.

COURT: 

15 CM 139:  Costs and 90 days time served- no DNA surcharge to be added as it was before the time period

Defendant Tyler J. Guibord in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Defendant Tyler J. Guibord in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes stmt.  Atty Larimore makes stmt resolution may be possible requests a motion date.  Court makes stmt.  Atty Larimore waived prelim in 14 CF 235.  Court advised the defendant as to his right to a preliminary exam.  Defendant does not wish to have a prelim in 14 CF 235.  Court finds defendant has freely waived his right to a prelim - finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Tyler J. Guibord in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Defendant Tyler J. Guibord in custody.  Atty Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14 TR 482, 15 CM 139, 14 CF 235.  Atty Larimore is requesting a motion hearing be set in 14 CF 165.  State makes stmt to the court.  Motion to be filed before the 1st of October.  Atty Larimore is requesting modification of bail makes arguement.  State objects to the reduction of bail.  Court:  bail modification is denied  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Defendant Tyler J. Guibord in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Defendant Tyler J. Guibord in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14 CF 235, 15 CM 139 and 14 TR 482.  9:05 AM  Court callse case and recites appearances.  State addressed the court discovery was just tendered and offer tendered to the attorney 5 minutes ago.  Atty Larimore requests another status conference be set.  Court makes stmt underlying charge is about a year old now.  Atty Larimore requests 3 weeks.  Status conference scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tyler J. Guibord in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Defendant Tyler J. Guibord in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14 TR 482, 15 CM 139 and 14 CF 165.   Atty Moldenhauer is requesting he w/draw as attorney as he and the defendant can not agree and the defendant wishes to have another atty appointed.  State does not object.  Court further addressed the defendant as to his right to a preliminary exam.  Court excused Atty Moldenhauer as attorney.  Court continues to address the defendant.   New Judge to be assigned    Defendant is requesting bond be modified requests signature bond.  State objects to the request.  Court:  motion is denied.

Defendant Tyler J. Guibord in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Defendant Tyler J. Guibord in custody.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14 TR 482 and 15 CM 139.  Atty Moldenhauer just assigned to the cases request prelim be set at a later date.    Atty Moldehauer request a $10,000.00 signature bond be ordered.  2:49 PM Court calls cases and recites appearances - bail modification requested.  Atty Yackel waives the modification.  Court Motion is denied.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Combined CBS $2,500 set on cases (15CM139, 14CF165, 14CF235).  
No Contact with Nicole Miller.  
SPECIAL BOND Conditions with DAILY Testing
1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.

3. Defendant shall be subject to DAILY TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.
